utterance.speaker: Cindy
utterance.content: You're bleeding through your bandage.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Good morning.

utterance.speaker: Cindy
utterance.content: Don't we need to get you to a doctor?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I am a doctor. That didn't come up last night?

utterance.speaker: Cindy
utterance.content: We didn't do a lot of talking.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm good.

utterance.speaker: Cindy
utterance.content: You never told me what caused your accident.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I was stabbed by a patient. That'll teach me to overbill.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If she likes crippled guys, I'm free for the next six minutes.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What do you want?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 45 year-old truck driver, recurrent seizures. No metabolic or structural…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Does this look like a good time?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sort of. At least as good as the other 12 times that I've called and paged you in the last three weeks.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Those times I just didn't feel like talking to you. Kinda like now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'd apologize again, but I'm still waiting for you to accept the first one. You do work for me. I am entitled to ask when you're coming back.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I don't know when I'm coming back. I don't know if I'm coming back. Got a problem with that, fire me.

utterance.speaker: Therapist
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's good to see you in the hospital, as a patient if not as a doctor.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Believe me, I'd rather be the guy with the clipboard.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How you doing?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Arrhythmias are gone. Fine motor control is improving.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Not what I meant. If you need to talk to someone, a professional…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm fine.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Fine enough to get back to work? You don't have to work for House, but you do owe me 20 clinic hours.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What, getting knifed doesn't buy me an extension?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Buys you whatever you need. But I know you. If all you do is physical therapy and your nighttime version of it, you'll lose your mind faster than you regain those fine motor skills.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Uh, have this terrible pain in my left shoulder. It came out of nowhere.

utterance.speaker: Sister Joan
utterance.content: And nothing seems to help.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Any other symptoms? Chest pain? Lightheadedness?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: No. None at all.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What were you doing when the pain came on?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Just sitting and praying.

utterance.speaker: Sister Joan
utterance.content: She'd been helping to make the altar breads that morning, but no hard physical work or repetitive motion.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: A couple of possibilities. You have enlarged lymph nodes, so I'd like to start by ruling out breast cancer. And I do mean "rule out." It's probably nothing. I'm gonna do a quick breast exam. Do you mind stepping out for a moment?

utterance.speaker: Sister Joan
utterance.content: Not at all.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That was so I could ask about the second possibility. Left-sided pain means it could be angina, which is made worse by stress. Might not be a coincidence that the pain started on the verge of a major life change.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: How did you know?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Blue Veil means you're a postulant, haven't taken your vows yet. Brown Vestments means you're Carmelites, cloistered nuns, which explains the chaperone. You're about to withdraw from the world for good. I was a seminarian.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Who obviously didn't take his vows.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Cassock made my ass look fat. Do you mind unbuttoning your shirt and lying down for me?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Okay. I have had second thoughts. I'm kind of a wreck.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: A life of perpetual enclosure and almost complete silence? If you weren't wrestling with this, I'd say there's something really wrong with you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm going to admit you. There's a little mass here, and I'd like to get it checked out.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's just a benign fat deposit. Her imaging's clean.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Stress test too. It's not angina. So why the shoulder pain?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is it possible that she hurt her shoulder?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Thanks a lot.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I didn't tell him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You were cagey about where you were going. And Chase being cagey in general. Good chance I'd find the two of you in the same cage. So I had Park follow you.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: How you feeling?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Better. Heard your arm's healing nicely.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Good to see you on your feet.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Patient's a nun? You turning back to your long-abandoned faith in time of trouble?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She was next up in the clinic. And I don't want your help.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You got stabbed. You blame me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But what did you learn about me that you hadn't known for years?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Maybe I was an idiot before and I'm not one now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or maybe the reverse is true.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Thanks for all your help.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your soul sister is having a fungal infection from the unprocessed wheat in the altar breads. Explains the shoulder pain and the jumbo lymph nodes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thanks for all my help.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I'm… I'm sorry I led House to you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's part of the job.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Maybe we could get a meal after work tonight, if you want some companionship.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You asking me out on a date?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: No. I just… I guess that sounded… must be scary to be back. All those knives and needles. Infected blood and tissue everywhere you look. Just thought you might need someone to talk to about it.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Just knowing you're there for me is enough. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Ever surf Kirra Point? Obviously you're Australian.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I've surfed all over the Gold Coast. Don't tell me you have?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: The closest I got was Waimea Bay. I grew up on Maui.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If you don't mind me asking, why are you becoming a nun?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: You asking 'cause I surf?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, I know that Jesus walked on water but… Plus the average postulant is a lot younger than you. What were you doing before this?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Not much of anything. Worked as a nanny. Moved around a lot. Bunch of failed relationships.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And then what? God spoke to you? You heard the calling?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Something like that. Does there have to be some dramatic moment where the skies part?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Usually, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Is that what happened to you when you entered the seminary?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Mom drank, dad worked. They stuck me in catholic school. Priests and nuns were the closest I had to family. Turned out that wasn't much of a reason to join the priesthood.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Is that why you left?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Something like that.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: I think, I may throw up.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: What's wrong with me?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Not a fungal infection.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're probably wondering, why the soda balloons?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm not.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, I'll tell you. You're not the only one whose life spiraled out of control when you got knifed in the ventricle. Taub has decided…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I need help with my patient. She's vomiting. That's not from a fungal infection.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What are you planning to do now that you're not working for me?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I have no idea. Almost dying's been clarifying. I can do anything.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You can do anything. So you come back to the same building you've worked in for years. Guess you can cross that off your bucket list.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Can we get to my patient sometime soon?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: As soon as you admit that you're a confused mess, sure.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You'll help me. 'Cause even though you don't find my case interesting, you find my interest in it interesting.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, when you put it that way… Ascending colangitis.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Missed me.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Can't be, bilirubin's normal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Clinical signs can show up days before lab signs.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Ha ha ha!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This is great. We should make this a regular thing.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: She can't feel her foot at all.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: What does this mean?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It means I've got to spend more time consulting with a colleague.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Ketosteroid levels are low. How can he be hyper-sexual?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He tried to tongue-kiss Park when you were closer. You think his sexuality is normal?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I need more help. My patient has a new symptom. Ischemic foot. Get the lecture out of your system so we can talk about my case.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Let me start with an allegory.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Okay, I'm curious.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your overreaction to your stabbing is to blame me even as you are drawn to me. Taub's is to take moronic self-defense classes that won't defend him against anything.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Krav Maga. Which helped me block your shot and will continue to help me defend myself in a building full of drugged-up strangers.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Taub has to accept that by instinct and genetics he is a coward, who's better off running and hiding at the first sign of danger.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I've already fended off six of your blitzkriegs in a row.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And the seventh? And the eighth? And the Nth?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If you get him, what's that gonna prove?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That unexpected things happen. By definition, no class can teach you to expect them. Which is why Taub is idiotic to study them, and you're idiotic to attach any significance to them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Blood clot.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Her D-dimer's normal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: On the other hand…

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yah!

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: What if he's right about the blockage but wrong about the cause? Vasospasm.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That explains everything but the lymph nodes. And any minor infection

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Calcium channel blocker to treat.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I almost got you killed by bringing a scalpel into that room. I could feel better about that.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You saved my life too. I think the ledger's clear. But how can you not be traumatized?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Can't change what happened. Can only make better choices from here.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: So you're Zen about it but won't let go of your anger toward House? I'm seeing a trauma counselor. I think you should too.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm okay. Just knowing you're there for me is enough.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Convent lets you have this?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: I borrowed it from one of the nurses. I'm still on temporary vows. It may be the last time I hear Eminem for a while.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're using an iPod. But I've never seen you use rosary beads.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What day did Jesus die?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: I know, one gospel says Passover; another says the day before.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How many times did the cock crow before Peter's third denial? Once or twice?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: You can't argue away my faith.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why? Because it's so strong even plain contradictions…

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Because it's not that strong. I'm not saying I don't have faith. I just haven't felt the calling yet.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No one joins the clergy without having that epiphany. That God's love is speaking to you directly.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: It's the silence, the contemplation, the order. I need them. Hoping everything else will come later.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That's not an answer. If you want silence, you can get ear plugs.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: I tried the outside world. It wasn't enough.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Ever been married?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No kids. You never found a career. Doesn't sound like the outside world got much of a try. What you're headed towards now, 14 hours a day in silent prayer, never having a family, never touching another human being.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Just because that's what you'd miss the most. The nurses talk.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Nothing's wrong with having fun.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: They said you were almost killed three weeks ago. You go right back to fun?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Is that why you wanna be a nun? Someone broke your heart?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: No. I'm just looking for something more.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So am I.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm late for work in the clinic.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Really? George Washingbaum?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He was a character in the Flintsteins. Just hiding out till House leaves the cafeteria.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The self-defense classes, you think they're making any kind of difference?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Not as much as House's surprise attacks. He thinks three steps ahead, so I do too. Which is why you should accept his apology and come back on the team. He's annoying, he's maddening, but he makes us all better.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Note to self.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Foot color's good. Arterial pulse is good. Capillary refill's good.

utterance.speaker: Sister Joan
utterance.content: And her shoulder pain’s all gone.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Looks like your ready to go…home.

utterance.speaker: Sister Joan
utterance.content: I’ll get the car and meet you out front.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I’d say I’m in the book but not the one you’ll be reading from now on.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Six years ago I…was a nanny in Honolulu. For this beautiful two-year old boy. I loved him, probably spent more time with him than his own parents. One day I was in the park talking with another nanny. He wandered out of the sandbox, into the street, into the path of a moving car.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That could have happened to anyone.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: I don't think so. And even if it did, they'd blame themselves for the rest of their lives too.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You shouldn't. You shouldn't run from what can still be a good life.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: I'm running to God. After what happened to you, don't you wanna remake your life?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Not by hiding myself away. I hope it works out for you.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: It is gonna be hard. Not touching anyone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who knew mother inferior was a smoking hottie. No wonder you're playing handsies with her.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You think I'm hitting on a nun? Angry at God or I just need a challenge?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or you're terrified of intimacy, which is why you're a serial slut. But right now you're grasping at an emotional life raft. Ideally someone for whom intimacy's not an option. That actually makes sense, which I can't say about anything else you've been doing.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm not emotionally involved with her. And much as I'd love to hear you contradict me, I have a 7:30 appointment to explore my intimacy issues at La Scala.

utterance.speaker: Leisha
utterance.content: I'm talking to this agent. He's a bit of a sleaze. But he's really excited about representing me.

utterance.speaker: Leisha
utterance.content: Although he can't take on any new clients right now, he's trying to get me an audition for one of those online soaps. Have you ever watched one of those? Am I boring you?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Unfortunately, yeah. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're not supposed to be here. Or anywhere.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: You were right. I was running away.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Oh, now you're shy.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: It's brighter in the morning.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So, are we gonna spend the rest of eternity in a lake of fire while pointy-tailed demons poke at us with sticks?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: This is a little scary for me. I had a whole life planned. Not that I wasn't struggling with it. And then I met you. Don't worry, I know you're not the relationship type.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm not, not the relationship type. I was married once.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Relax. You're fine.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So what's next for you?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: I have to find a place to live. Get my old job back. Sure, I'll feel guilty, start doubting.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: As long as you keep dealing with your doubts in the same way then… Moira?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: sorry, did you say something?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Your neck.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Are your ears ringing?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Yeah. What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We've got to get you back to the hospital right away.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The artery that's bringing blood to your brain, it's coming apart. Means you could stroke. I've paged a team of our best doctors.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: I don't have to cough as much.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's clotted up.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Is that bad?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We're almost there.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Get me her O-two level. What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I want to make sure I can position her wrist properly.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: A.B.G.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I don't need an A.B.G., just get a pulse OX. I'll do it. Grab a consent form. Go! We need to operate right now, okay?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Good to operate.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Repeat this: no ifs, ands, or buts about it.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: No about it and no ifs.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Get her into O.R. eleven.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Carotid dissection, four-inch pulsatile mass in her neck, and some Broca's aphasia. It's got to be a clot keeping her from bleeding out.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Pulse?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Bounding, four-plus. It was a three-plus 20 minutes ago.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Twenty? Thought she just got here. That blood looks pretty dry. Cut yourself shaving? You know, that can happen when the nun you woke up with coughs blood on you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You slept with a nun?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Forget nun, you slept with a patient?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Former, to both.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Internal neck trauma, that's impressive. It's happened to me a few times. Up high.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Dr. Chase.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Clot’s broken. Bring her in and pack her nose. I'm gonna need number three Vicryls. I'm gonna fix this.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You're not gonna operate on her.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Kapur and Carlyle are unavailable. Reilly's done far fewer dissections than I have.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's also slept with her far fewer times than you have.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Your judgment's compromised.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I spent the night with her. Doesn't change how I make an incision.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Tell him!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do the surgery.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You're trying to score points with him at the risk of a patient's life.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He’s the better surgeon.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Vascular clamp.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're not gonna put her on bypass?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It'd take a half hour to set up.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You clamp now, she could stroke out.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She's already got neurological symptoms. We wait 30 minutes, she'll definitely have brain damage.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You're trying to make sure she's either perfect or dead.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She's not going to die. If I get this done in five minutes, she won't stroke out.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You don't know that you will. And you can't know because you can't think clearly about her.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Vascular clamp.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Occlusion time 9:46 and 24 seconds. Vascular scissors.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We're over five minutes.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Ultrasound.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Good flow. Lighten the anesthesia.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're not gonna close the wound first?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Can you hear me? Repeat this: no ifs, ands, or buts.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: No ifs, ands, or buts.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I'm sorry about before.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're scared, aren't you? That's why you wanted companionship. That's why you cried out when House shot at Taub. What exactly are you scared of? A needle stick? Some other nut pulling a scalpel?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I'm scared of everything.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It sucks that there was a stabbing. But you'll get over it.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Like you have?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You weren't even there.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I know, I… I left the room. It was pure luck.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I was in the room. That was pure luck too. I get that you're scared and guilty. You're still a doctor. I don't have time to teach you to act like one.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We removed the artery. I found nodules.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Could mean lupus.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Negative A.N.A. Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great thing about assigning Taub fraudulent lab work is you know exactly where he's gonna end up. Great thing about assigning Taub obviously fraudulent lab work is you get to watch his inner paranoiac at work.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And then…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Two to the head.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Can we talk about my patient?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Quite a journey. Starts with a surgical tool in your heart and ends with a surgeon's tool in a nun. What's the plan?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Plan's to cure her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, if it's not meaningless sex, kinda screams out for an end game. You're the dog that's chasing the popemobile. You sure you want…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, my God. Taub is interrogating the janitor. He must think that I hired him to attack… actually, why didn't I do that? Plaques could be confused for nodules. Which would mean…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Syphilis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Explains the shoulder and foot involvement. Hope you practiced immaculate contraception.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Lock and load.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Boo-yah!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pfft!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Boo-yah to you too.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: But I hadn't had sex in years.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Tertiary syphilis means you've had the disease for at least that long.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Does that mean you also have it?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Probably not contagious at this point.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Can it cause hallucinations?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's unlikely. Why?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: While I was on the operating table, it didn't feel like a dream. I saw the boy who I was caring for. The one who died. He walked right up to me.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What did he say?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: He just held my hand. It was like he forgave me. Do you think that's crazy?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I think it should give you solace, help you to move on.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You slept with your patient? You're off the case.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I saved her from brain damage. You think my judgment's the least bit compromised?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She's still sick. If she dies, we'll be in the middle of a brand-new investigation.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: This is about you covering your own ass.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I gave you time, leeway, and you decided to do whatever the hell you wanted.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House can dance all over the rules, gets me knifed, and he gets a pass. I break a rule, no one gets hurt, but you kick me off my own case?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Unfortunately, yes.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I took that scalpel for you.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: That's why I did this. Three weeks ago, you never would have slept with a patient. And you never would have operated on her after. You need help.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I need to get away from House and everything that reminds me of him.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: By breaking the rules, not caring what anyone else thinks. You're gonna get away from him by turning into him?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: It hurts.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Right upper quadrant, pain and distension.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: What's wrong with my stomach?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Nothing. This is your liver.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: The liver failure could be from intraoperative hypotension.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Checked the anesthesia sheet, pressure was fine throughout. Thrombus?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That voice in the hall that none of us have any reason to be listening to is, not surprisingly, wrong. Abdominal ultrasound was negative.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Then we have to assume liver failure is just another symptom of whatever she's got.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Trousseau's syndrome could send clots, cause the ischemic foot. Add the enlarged lymph node, macrocytosis.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Disseminated T-cell lymphoma.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Wilson said it wasn't cancer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wilson says it's not breast cancer.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Sarcoidosis.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Normal ace level.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Highly insensitive for sarcoid.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Negative chest X-rays aren't.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Then we've got to biopsy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, Foreman's clearly wrong. You're clearly not grasping at straws 'cause you're clearly not emotionally involved. I know you want to believe that this is something we can cure. It's not. I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: How soon will they know if it's cancer?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Within hours.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: And if it is?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: There's always chemo.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: You say that like it's not gonna work.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Could extend your life.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Years?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'll be here as much as you need.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: You still never told me why you left the seminary.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Mary Knoller. Wife of the groundskeeper. He caught me with her, got me with a rake. Those scars on my ass you may have noticed.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Why didn't you tell me that before?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Because it was so shallow. I wasn't exactly wrestling with great theological questions.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: I don't believe that. You don't sleep with the groundskeeper's wife, not unless you're struggling with whether you belong there.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I always wanted to believe. It would have made my life a lot easier. It never took.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Doesn't… mean… it's too late.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Are you having trouble talking, like before?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: I can get the words out. Just feels heavy when I do.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Where?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Wherever my chewing muscles are.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'll be right back.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House finally got you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He tried but…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You shoulda seen it. It was perfect.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She has jaw claudication. If you only heard claudication and carotid dissection…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'd say giant cell arteritis. And I'd tell your former teammates to put her on steroids.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She's gonna live.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. And then what?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: They say my liver function's better. That I can get out of here soon.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And when you do, I'm gonna take you to Puerto Escondido.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Mexico?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The Mexican pipeline. Early May is when the surf really picks up but… what's wrong?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: I spoke to the prioress.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're going back?

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: I felt the calling.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: When you saw the boy.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: I felt God's love, his grace. I've been waiting my entire life for that.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's not real.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: I know you didn't feel anything when you almost died. I did.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You felt oxygen depravation. You felt your brain releasing noradrenaline.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: You didn't say that before.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I wanted you to move on with your life. I wanted to reassure you. I wanted you to feel better.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: And now you don't?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Now… I think I love you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: "Noradrenaline and near-death experiences." Oh, dear. You saw God?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She did. She wants to go back to the monastery.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So now you're preparing a Powerpoint presentation to keep her in your garden of earthly delights. You're an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Because I found someone I love?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because you're an idiot. At least you two have that in common.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Her feelings are based on a chemical process. They're gonna wear off.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You just slept with her. Your brain is exploding with oxytocin. You think that's gonna last through the ages?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She's throwing away her life because of blind faith.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So are you! She's found something she wants to build her life around. It's a total illusion, but apparently she'll take a little ignorance with her bliss. And you want to take that away?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How many times have you thrown the truth in people's faces?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because it's the truth, not because we're gonna live happily ever after.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Either your relationship just blows up like every other non-magical romance, or she stays with you but blames you for stripping all the meaning out of her life.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: This has nothing to do with the truth. You don't like that I'm reassessing my life, that I want to change it, that I can.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Anyone can screw up a life. I never said that wasn't possible.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're incapable of human connection, so you want everyone to be like you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If I wanted you to be like me… I would be urging you to make a stupid, stubborn decision that blows up your life and leaves you lonely and miserable. You reassess your life when you've made mistakes. You didn't. You just got stabbed.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Don't look at the book.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I haven't done a jugular line since my residency. I don't want to needle the carotid.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What's the first step?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Palpate the S.C.M.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Where?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Middle third of the neck.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm happy I knew you.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: So am I.

utterance.speaker: Moira
utterance.content: Robert.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: 40 year-old water treatment worker with pyrexia and double vision.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: … You said he worked in a sewer…

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Abscess?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Would have seen it on the MRI.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Diphtheria paralyzing the ocular muscles?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: No, paralysis was first. Aneurysm?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Not with this fever. Maybe we're thinking about this the wrong way. Retro-ocular infection?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: With no local symptoms?
